subdefinitions.definition: Above ; higher than; further up than.
examples: Hold the sign up over your head.
The mountain towered over the village.

subdefinitions.definition: Across , from one side to the other.
examples: The guide took us over the border.

subdefinitions.definition: Across , so as to pass above.
examples: The vulture flew over the desert.
I looked out over the sea.

subdefinitions.definition: Through or around all the parts of.
examples: The estate agent showed me over the property.
We went over the cathedral and then had lunch in the cafe.
(figuratively) We went over the figures together.
(figuratively)
He lives over the road from me.
The next town is over that hill.

subdefinitions.definition: At or near (a location seen as 'across' from the speaker's location).
examples: There was a big fire over the other side of town.

subdefinitions.definition: From one physical position to another via an obstacle that must be traversed vertically , first upwards and then downwards .
examples: The dog jumped over the fence.
Let's walk over the hill to get there.
The lava bubbled up and over the rim of the crater.
The car drove straight over the edge of the cliff.
I tripped over a tree root.

subdefinitions.definition: On top of; in such a way as to cover.
examples: Drape the fabric over the table.
There is a roof over the house.
(figuratively) A strange feeling came over me.
(figuratively)

subdefinitions.definition: More than (a given value, amount, limit etc.); beyond ; past ; exceeding .
examples: He is over a hundred years old.
It's over a hundred degrees outside.
I think I’m over my limit for calories for today.
I prefer the purple over the pink.
Sales are down this quarter over last.
He's got grumpier over the years.
I'll have to work over the weekend.

definitions.definition: Through or via (a particular transmission medium).
examples: A stern voice boomed over the loudspeaker.
The message came over FM radio.

definitions.definition: Indicating relative status, authority, or power
examples: The owner's son lorded it over the experienced managers.
The prince ruled over a portion of the kingdom.

definitions.definition: In a position of having overcome (a problem or issue); past ; finished with ; from one state to another via a hindrance that must be solved or defeated ; or via a third state that represents a significant difference from the first two .
examples: We got over the engineering problems and the prototype works great.
I am over my cold and feel great again.
I know the referee made a bad call, but you have to get over it [your annoyance with the referee's decision].
She is finally over [the distress of] losing her job.
He is finally over his [distress over the loss of the relationship with his] ex-girlfriend.

definitions.definition: While doing an activity involving (something), especially while consuming .
examples: We had a chat over dinner.
He fell asleep over the crossword puzle.
The two boys had a fight over whose girlfriend was the best.

definitions.definition: Above, implying superiority after a contest; in spite of; notwithstanding.
examples: We triumphed over difficulties.
The bill was passed over the veto.
It was a fine victory over their opponents.
I can't hear you over the noise of that road drill.

definitions.definition: Expressing causation : due to , as the result of.
examples: He was fired over that.
Two over six equals one over three.

definitions.definition: Separates the three of a kind from the pair in a full house .
Separates the primary chord of a slash chord from the bass note

secondary_definitions: Through or via (a particular transmission medium).
Indicating relative status, authority, or power

In a position of having overcome (a problem or issue); past ; finished with ; from one state to another via a hindrance that must be solved or defeated ; or via a third state that represents a significant difference from the first two .
While doing an activity involving (something), especially while consuming .
Above, implying superiority after a contest; in spite of; notwithstanding.
Expressing causation : due to , as the result of.
( poker ) Separates the three of a kind from the pair in a full house .
( music , more common in speech ) Separates the primary chord of a slash chord from the bass note
